result.execSummary:
The defendant Reno DaCoda Thom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Reno Dakota Thom in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $500 signature bond with conditions.    Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim VMW, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere., Must take all prescribed medicines as prescribed., Curfew 7pm to 7am. My be permitted on a one time basis to residence for purpose of removing essential personal property with an officer of the law.
